channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL

  • Description: XPO contacted ERTS to report a two gallon release of regulated UN1263 "TEMPERKOTEÂ® 600 32 OFF WHITE" that was damaged at Terminal NBM. The caller stated that a five-gallon plastic pail was crushed by heavier freight during offloading operations impacting the dock.

item.title: Report E-2024040081
item.description:
Report E-2024040081

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-08T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 28, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of sodium hydroxide had a leaking bung and released approximately twenty-five (25) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES closed the valve on the nozzle completely which halted the leak. HES placed a zip tie on the valve to prevent further accidental opening. All impacted absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged onsite. The drum containing liquid product was labeled as hazardous waste and staged onsite for disposal.
